title: Officials: Charlie Kirk’s killer blended in on campus; high-powered rifle recovered
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Charlie Kirk was shot and killed from a distant rooftop at Utah Valley University; shooter used high-powered rifle.
The suspect blended in on campus, is believed to be college-aged, and fled into a nearby neighborhood.
3,000 attendees witnessed the incident; the campus was evacuated and will remain closed until Monday.

title: ‘Laughable’: College football analyst’s blunt take on Bill Belichick’s start at UNC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Bill Belichick starts UNC football coaching with a 1-1 record, beating Charlotte but losing decisively to TCU.
Paul Finebaum criticized Belichick's performance and decision to ban Patriots scouts, calling his early tenure 'fairly laughable.'
Finebaum suggested Belichick's remarks make future struggles likely, citing his age and volatile coaching style as factors.

title: This Mass. woman just placed 2nd on NBC’s ‘American Ninja Warrior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Addy Herman from Pembroke placed 2nd in NBC's 2025 'American Ninja Warrior: Women's Championship'.
Herman and her boyfriend, Noah Meunier, both achieved 2nd place in their respective 2025 'American Ninja Warrior' competitions.
The couple trains together at Vitality Obstacle Fitness in Fall River, with Herman currently designing a signature ninja shoe.

title: 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Capricho Colombian Steakhouse set to open in Brookline, offering wood-grilled cuts and live music, pending liquor licenses.
Elephantine Bakery, known for French technique pastries, opens soft launch in Boston's Seaport District.
Eastern Standard hosts Pickle Week with game day pickle specials and a patio pickle party, starting Sept. 12.

title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis, a Bruins prospect, impressed at the 2025 IIHF World Championships with four goals and six points in seven games.
Locmelis transitioned to pro hockey with Boston's Providence Bruins, scoring 12 points in six AHL games during the 2024-25 season.
Bruins training camp highlights include Locmelis as a standout, praised for adaptability and high hockey IQ, aiming for a roster spot.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye, saying he looked timid in their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Maye had a strong first half but struggled in the second, throwing an interception and failing to score.
Gronkowski called for more assertiveness from Maye, highlighting the importance of development between first and second NFL years.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, of Braintree, died weeks after being hit by an e-bike at Copley Square, Boston police report.
Dang was struck near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street on August 6 and suffered life-threatening injuries.
The e-bike operator remained at the scene; no charges have been filed, and the operator's identity is undisclosed.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston Harbor will experience 'wicked high' perigean spring tides periodically this fall due to the moon's orbit and phases.
King tides occur when the moon at perigee aligns with the sun and Earth, raising tides by two to four feet.
The Stone Living Lab will host high tide events at Long Wharf, starting Thursday and continuing through December.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs defended Patriots QB Drake Maye's resilience, calling him tough and open to constructive criticism.
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in the Patriots' loss to the Raiders.
Diggs, recovering from an ACL tear, made six catches for 57 yards in his Patriots debut against the Raiders.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State audit found 22 child abuse reports uninvestigated by Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE).
Audit revealed DESE's communication breakdown with Department of Child and Families lasted 41 months, affecting child abuse report processing.
DESE also delayed special education complaint resolutions and did not fulfill responsibilities to Massachusetts Commission on LGBTQ Youth.
